<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

full_cot:
<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<think>
Okay, so I need to figure out what these three terms mean: gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load. The user has given me options from A to H, each listing different explanations for each term. My task is to choose the correct one based on my understanding. First, let's break down each term: 1. **Gene Pool**: This should refer to the entire stock of genetic material available in a population. It includes all the genes present in the organisms, both in diploid and haploid states. So, it's like the raw material that can be passed on through reproduction. 2. **Balanced Polymorphism (or Polymorphic Balance)**: I'm not entirely sure about this one. I know that polymorphisms are different forms of the same gene, but balanced polymorphism might imply that there's some sort of equilibrium or balance between different alleles. Maybe it refers to having multiple alleles maintaining their frequencies without any drift or selection pressure favoring one over another too much. Or perhaps it means that the population maintains multiple alleles at a locus because of balancing factors like migration or genetic drift. 3. **Genetic Load**: This usually refers to the total number of genetic mutations existing in a population. These mutations can lead to phenotypic changes, which might either be advantageous or disadvantageous depending on their context. Genetic load also relates to how many new genes are being passed on, affecting the overall fitness of the population. Now, looking at the options: - **Option F** mentions "gene pool refers to a single gene." That doesn't sound right because a gene pool isn't just a single gene—it's the entire set. Also, "balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene" seems off since dominance is more about whether one allele masks another, not necessarily about balance. - **Option G** says "Gene pool is the total number of alleles..." Wait, no, a gene pool would include all alleles across all populations, not just the total number. Hmm, maybe it's referring to the total alleles, but I'm not sure. Wait, actually, no—the term "total number of alleles" might refer to counting all alleles in the population, considering both dominant and recessive alleles. But I think that's conflating things. Alternatively, option G could be mixing up concepts. Let me look again. - **Option C** talks about "gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population"—that makes sense. Then "balanced polymorphism is when different forms...equilibrium over time." Hmm, that sounds a bit off. It might mean that different genotypes maintain their frequencies despite selection pressures, perhaps due to migration or mutation introducing new alleles. - **Option D** says "genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species." No, genetic diversity refers to the variety of genes, but genetic load is specific to the number of new mutations introduced each generation. So D might be incorrect. Looking back at **Option B**, it correctly defines the gene pool as the physical pool where genes are stored. Balanced polymorphism as imbalance in allele frequencies—that seems plausible. Genetic load as the genetic weight—so the number of deleterious alleles? Wait, no, genetic load is typically about the number of new mutations, not directly about alleles. Hmm, maybe I got confused here. Another approach: thinking about each term separately. Gene Pool: Yes, the complete set of genes. Balanced Polymorphism: If it's about maintaining multiple alleles without drift, then it must involve some form of balancing force, maybe like migration or genetic drift causing allele frequencies to reach equilibrium. Genetic Load: It's the total number of mutations in a population, often leading to changes in allele frequencies. So putting it together, **Option B** seems better because: Gene pool is physical location where genes are stored. Balanced polymorphism is when different alleles exist, possibly due to balancing forces. Genetic load is the genetic weight, i.e., the number of harmful alleles.
</think>
The correct answer is B

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Not quite, because genetic weight usually refers to the cumulative effect. Maybe it's better phrased as the genetic burden, but the wording here matches Option B. Gene pool as the collection of genes in a single organism—that's technically incorrect because an organism has a set of genes (its genotype) rather than a single gene. Genetic load as the number of genes in an organism is also incorrect because the number of genes is fixed, unless considering DNA methylation or something else. So Option E is completely wrong.

The correct answer is G

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is meant by a gene pool, balanced polymorphism, and genetic load?

A. Gene pool is the total number of organisms in a population; balanced polymorphism is a genetic imbalance; genetic load is the genetic weight of an organism.

B. Gene pool refers to the physical pool where genes are stored; balanced polymorphism is the imbalance of allele frequencies; genetic load is the amount of genetic information carried by an organism.

C. Gene pool is the sum total of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is when different forms of a genotype are maintained in equilibrium over time; genetic load is the reduction in average fitness due to presence of suboptimal forms.

D. Gene pool is the total genetic information in the gametes of a population; balanced polymorphism is the consistent occurrence of a single allele; genetic load is the genetic diversity within a species.

E. Gene pool is the collection of genes in a single organism; balanced polymorphism is the variation of a single gene; genetic load is the number of genes in an organism.

F. Gene pool refers to a single gene; balanced polymorphism refers to a dominance of one gene; genetic load refers to the genetic burden of an organism.

G. Gene pool is the total number of alleles in a population; balanced polymorphism is the maintenance of two or more alleles at a locus by natural selection; genetic load is the proportion of individuals in a population with genetic defects.

H. Gene pool is the diversity of genes in a population; balanced polymorphism is the dominance of a single gene; genetic load is the genetic capacity of an organism.

I. Gene pool is the sum of all genetic variations in a closed environment; balanced polymorphism is the equal representation of all alleles in a population; genetic load is the accumulated genetic mutations in a population.

J. Gene pool is the set of all genetic traits in a biological community; balanced polymorphism is when one allele is favored over others; genetic load is the genetic contribution of an organism to its offspring.
